## Setting up the data frame. Using the file from springboard

```{r}
original_titanic <- read.csv("titanic_original.csv", header = TRUE, sep = ",")

# Checking the missing values in the embarked column.
summary(original_titanic$embarked)
```


```{r}
# embarked is a factor column.
class(original_titanic$embarked)

# Define function to replace the null values.
find_missing <- function(x) {
  if (x == "") {
    x <- as.character('S')
  } else {
    as.character.factor(x)
  }
}

# Apply the function.
original_titanic$embarked <- lapply(original_titanic$embarked, find_missing)
```

# Calculate the mean of the ages to fill in the missing values.
# Think about other ways to calculate the missing values.
```{r}
mean_age <- mean(original_titanic$age, na.rm = TRUE)
mean_age
mean_trim_age <- mean(original_titanic$age, na.rm = TRUE, trim = 0.3)
mean_trim_age
median_age <- median(original_titanic$age, na.rm = TRUE)
median_age
range_age <- range(original_titanic$age, na.rm = TRUE)
range_age

mode <- function(x) {
  ux <- na.omit(unique(x))
  ux[which.max(tabulate(match(x, ux)))]
}
mode_age <- mode(original_titanic$age)
mode_age
```
